storyInfo: Misfortune has befallen all the clients that the jeweler Heinz has dealt with in the past year and a half. This time, he has seven days to replicate a rare crystal that was offered to the Twin Empresses.

attributes.content: Grinden, Kreis Eingeweide, Leithanien
*Sigh*...
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Finally, my eyes don't ache so much anymore. Finally, I can sleep...
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Search everywhere! Check the equipment on his table especially carefully!
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: Locked box? Just blast it open! Rip the shelves apart! Take apart the gramophone!
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: And you—
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: Spit it out, now.
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: What would you like me to say, meine Herr? All I know is that the box you just destroyed was placed in my care by a client, and that it's very valuable...
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Are you accusing Graf Saxon of causing your loss?
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: Of course not.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: You look too sly to be playing dumb, kid.
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: ...Well, what business brings his lordship the Graf down from his spire to this humble abode in its shadow?
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: It would be my pleasure to be of service.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: No traps over here.
attributes.name: Graf's Guard

attributes.content: Nothing here either.
attributes.name: Graf's Guard

attributes.content: ...You have good eyes, I'll give you that.
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: Everyone, outside.
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: I regret that we must meet in the middle of this mess. I hope you don't mind.
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: Of course not, meine Herr. The shop is closed for the day. Please, go ahead.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: You're smart, Heinz. Good.
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: Y-Your Excellency...
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: Ewigegnade wants a unique crystal for this year's Empress' Celebration. The whole country's been looking for one, ever since the edict was issued.
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: I had promised Her Majesty that Grinden would fulfill her wish.
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: But have you any idea how much effort it took to find that one bicolor crystal?
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: Deep, rich blacks and bright, shining golds in equal balance, neither overwhelming the other, not one speck of impurity in either.
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: Perfect proportions, perfect colors, like Leithanien's Eternal Grace and Austere Authority themselves.
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: I called it Zwillingstürmeträume. There could be no more fitting gift for Their Majesties!
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: The Empresses' Voice will be here in seven days to retrieve the gem, yet someone managed to get through all my guards and steal it?
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: Did the thief's Arts let him pilfer from a mile away, or turn himself into thin air?
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: Or have I simply hired a bunch of useless trash?
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: We will begin the search immediately. Leave no stone in Grinden unturned...
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: Search? You don't even know who did it, or how?!
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: ...Find Heinz.
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: You're asking me to—
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: I'm not asking. I'm giving you an order.
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: You appraised the Zwillingstürmeträume. You must remember its fantastic color, and the starlight within. No one who's seen it could ever forget.
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: Recreate it, Heinz, in all its glory!
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: B-But I'm just a humble apprentice appraiser. The cutting equipment here is only fit for private research, perhaps embedding ornamental gems in instruments and wands, at best.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: It's really too much to ask me to do the work of a master cutter and replicate such a treasure.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: It's unlikely that Their Majesties' gemologists would be fooled by an ordinary replica. If this is found out, I—
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Enough.
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: I sponsored you because of your talents in appraisal and cutting.
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: I was even considering you for whatever the equivalent of concertmaster is in your field, here in Grinden.
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: ...It would be an honor to receive that title from you.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: But do not forget how you made your name as an appraiser.
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: Don't fool yourself. This isn't the first time you've made a counterfeit. I can live with losing you. Can you say the same?
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: I've never forgotten.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: I never forget, Your Excellency.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Excuse my impudence, but the reflection on your buttons changed quite significantly when the sun came out from behind the clouds just now.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: So you can scan the surrounding environment through the refraction of light, even in a dark valley like this... Aren't you being a little too wary?
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: Naturally, I would never complain about His Excellency's guards.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: However, I'm carrying materials that can be used to create gem replicas. You must understand that I must be more cautious than usual when walking through places like this, where the glory of the spire is distant.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: And... I'm made even more uneasy when I think of who I must deceive.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Speaking of which, would you take a look at these materials, and tell me if any are similar to the texture of the Zwillingstürmeträume?
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: Looks like the Graf's faith in you was not misplaced.
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: Seize this opportunity, kid, and you'll be rewarded when the Graf earns the favor of the Twin Empresses.
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: Opportunity...
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Danke. It's just that this... opportunity... is rather daunting.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: I'm just a normal guy who fell in love with gems. I didn't know the first thing about cutting or counterfeiting.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: You know very well what the Graf sees in you.
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: To me, it was just a series of coincidences.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: I still remember the first gem I ever faked. It was lousy, even for a forgery.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: I didn't have the guts to use good materials, or the skills to mend cracks with leaded glass and resin.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: But as an apprentice of the jewelry store, I could get it into the display with implicit, even explicit permission, skipping the appraisal.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: I was even more afraid than I am now, ready to flee at a moment's notice. I even spent many sleepless nights contemplating if I should turn myself in to the police.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: But you were never found out, or we wouldn't be talking about this now.
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: A baron bought the fake gem at a grand price, and I left the jewelry store.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: I learned later that he wasn't particularly wealthy, and that buying the gem was a gamble for him, trying to restore his status in high society.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Better-trained eyes saw through my lousy counterfeit immediately. The baron went mad, and he was never heard from again.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: I was lucky. Somehow, no one cared about the death of petty noble like that, so no one ever came after me.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Ha, a lowly baron clinging to whatever meager status he had by licking the boots of the truly great. Of course nobody cared.
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: You also helped a scholar make a fool of his rival, didn't you?
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: I had even less to do with that. Or should I say, I merely made a mistake.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: As you know, my wand is powered by leftover gemstone roughs, which I acquire at a very reasonable price.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: For some reason, though, there was a complete gem in that one shipment of roughs.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Do you really not know how it happened?
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: I didn't dare think too much about it.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Even if a magician knows that his trick has malfunctioned, and that the saw really will cut his assistant in half, what choice does he have but to close his eyes and make the cut?
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Later, I learned that a secretary had been punished for selling a gem he had been entrusted to guard.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: But by that time, it had been reduced to dust in my test tube.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: And...
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: And the fake appraisal that caught the Graf's attention.
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: I thought Graf Saxon had come to make me pay for ruining his nephew's reputation, who held the honorable title of Vizegraf.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: You simply did as you were told, and appraised a second-rate gem like it was an exceptional treasure.
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: Then the foolish Vizegraf Saxon showed off that fake appraisal along with the gem at every opportunity, and became a laughingstock.
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: Ja... I simply did as I was told.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Not only was His Excellency not angry, he regarded my skills highly. I don't know how I can ever repay his kindness.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: All you need to do is follow your orders faithfully.
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: Your humility is one of the reasons the Graf appreciates you, Heinz. Don't try to be too cunning.
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: Ja, meine Herr.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Enough small talk.
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: The Empresses' Voice will arrive at Grinden in three days. Any flaw in our tribute, and there will be a smoldering ruin where the Graf's spire once stood.
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: Time to get back to your worktable.
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: There's another story about gems that led me to where I am today.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: A story about a mine that exploded and collapsed for no apparent reason.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: But if no one cared about the fate of one lowly noble, why would anyone care about this story of poor, unfortunate commoners?
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: (Whistle)♪
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: (Whistle)♪♪
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Do not let me hear that vulgar whistling again, Heinz. At the very least, I forbid it in my spire.
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: Sorry, Your Excellency. I got carried away.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: It's the first time I've ever set foot atop the spire of a Graf. From up here, all the buildings of Grinden look like hunchbacks who couldn't straighten their postures.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: I'm not here to listen to your philosophical insights, Heinz. The Empresses' Voice arrives today. Where is the Zwillingstürmeträume?
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: On the table, Your Excellency.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: When I was little, I liked to strain my neck looking up from the dirty shacks.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: I often imagined feeling the wind atop the spire, like it must feel so clean and fresh up there...
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Silence, Heinz!
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: Is this the gem you counterfeited for me? This is the Zwillingstürmeträume?
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: The wooden box holding the gem strikes the ground. The Graf holds a bicolor crystal between his thumb and forefinger.
His voice has gone coarse from screaming at Heinz at the top of his lungs, his self-restraint faltering before his anger.
Careful. You don't want to drop it.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: I gave you seven days, gave you all the supplies and support you needed, all so that you could make full use of your talents in cutting and crafting. And THIS is your answer?
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: J-Ja, Your Excellency.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: 'Ja'? Do you take me for a fool?
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: You're the best appraiser in Grinden. Can you not tell that this... thing... is not even the equal of the glass beads one can buy by the bagful at the marketplace for a pittance?
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: This dirty shade of gold! The interior is uneven, causing the light to refract as though in a maze.
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: And this black! Rough like a mundane rock in the barrens, cheap like the curtains in a backwater bar.
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: And the combination of the two is disorganized and stilted.
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: Where is the fantastic color? The starlight within? The unique beauty of the colors blending?
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: You expect me to offer this contemptible rock to the Kaiserin?
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: Are you trying to get my skull crushed under Their Majesties' boots? My spire leveled to the ground?
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: How dare you take me for a fool, Heinz!
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: Clack.
With a crack, the Zwillingstürmeträume is no longer whole, the bicolor crystal reduced to fragments by the fingers of Graf Saxon.
I'll have your head for this, Heinz.
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: Please, Your Excellency, I can explain!
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Heinz opens the valve on his wand. He bends down to retrieve a few fragments and inserts them into it.
Taking a few steps back, Heinz finds the right angle, then snaps his fingers. The tip of the wand lights up.
Beneath the light, the deep black and dignified gold shine like a lake at sunset.
This...
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: You could have submitted it to the Kaiserin. That was the original Zwillingstürmeträume.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: How could this be?
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: I examined it so closely...
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: Simple, Your Excellency. The Zwillingstürmeträume was an ordinary crystal.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Did you forget? I was the one who appraised it. It was placed in an ornate box, and illuminated by the light of my wand. Find just the right angle, and just the right brightness...
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: And there. The fantastic color, and the starlight within.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: I might be so bold as to call refraction one of my special talents.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: You?
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: You, a layman, should not doubt the skill of a professional.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: You made me promise Her Majesty, then stole the gem, then tricked me into destroying it with my own hands?
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: You've brought ruin to the spire of Graf Saxon! And for what?!
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: Do not forget that I was the one who took you in, who gave you a living working with gems at my spire!
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: With your laughable resume and all the people you've fallen afoul of... did you really think you had a future in Grinden?
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: Of course I remember your kindness, Your Excellency.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: I was just an ordinary man ready to give up.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: I couldn't sleep the night I ground that stolen gem into dust, worried that the secretary who sold it would use his connections within the city council to find me.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: And when I made the fake appraisal and ruined Vizegraf Saxon's reputation...
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: I was worried my plan was so rough around the edges that an accomplished schemer like yourself would see through it in an instant.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: I did catch your attention, but fortunately you were only interested in how you could use me.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: You didn't even bother to do a background check on the ruined baron and the jailed secretary.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: And why would you remember? It's been twenty years, and they were just some insignificant, lowly commoners.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: What... what do you mean?
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: I mean I was after you from the very beginning.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: I've been after you, Graf Saxon, ever since I returned to Grinden a year and a half ago and sold a poorly forged gem to that baron.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: ...But why?
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: Like I said, you wouldn't remember.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: The Empresses' Voice should be at the spire now. You boasted to the Golden Empress that you would submit a unique gem as your tribute for the Empresses' Celebration...
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: So what will you do now?
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Guards!
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: Catch that bastard!
attributes.name: Graf Saxon

attributes.content: Another snap of the fingers.
The balcony becomes a cacophony of light, with the wand as the starting point. Only then does the Graf realize that there are countless mirrors, hidden in every corner.
The light obscures his vision, then converges on Heinz, and then—
The jeweler disappears from the Graf's sight.
In the last moments, the Graf sees him smile.
The groveling jeweler has always been meek, humble, timid... he has never smiled so brazenly.
With such scorn, hatred.
Good luck, Graf.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: M-Meine Herr, the Empresses' Voice is here.
attributes.name: Graf's Attendant

attributes.content: This isn't an instrument shop, kid. I can't repair that for you.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: You thought you'd get away that easily, after making a fool of the Graf of Grinden?
Herr Heinz, am I right?
Michael, of Zwillingstürme.
You're awfully young for an Empresses' Voice.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Because I'm not, just a messenger of her will.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: The spire of Graf Saxon has been impounded. He will be escorted to Zwillingstürme, where he will face the judgment of the Kaiserin. As for you...
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Uh-huh.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Er, put down your wand. Take it easy.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I just wanted to confirm a few things.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: There's something in common between the clients of your gem business who've had misfortune befall them over the past year and a half.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: The baron who lost his entire fortune was the overseer of a mine. The secretary who went to prison for embezzling the gem drafted the report of a certain mine disaster.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: ...And the mine was jointly owned by Vizegraf and Graf Saxon.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I thought I'd be rotting in the spire dungeons by now. Looks like you've been busy since yesterday.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: You were after revenge, weren't you?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Twenty years ago, Graf Saxon ran a secret mine in Grinden, supplying Originium to the Witch King's contraptions.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: The Twin Empresses' coup turned Leithanien upside down. Two new spires rose from the capital.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: To facilitate his change in loyalties, Graf Saxon ordered the Originium mine blown up, with all the workers inside.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: In his report to Zwillingstürme, he wrote that a collapse had occurred at a mine for exotic crystals.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: ...Ja. My parents worked in that mine.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: My life was never the same afterwards.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: I left Grinden, met a lot of people, saw a lot of things, caught Oripathy, acquired this staff, and had no choice but to go back to dealing in shining rocks.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: I suppose you're too young to understand all this.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: If you came to corroborate my crimes, I can tell you that I was planning to cause an explosion and bury Graf Saxon in the dirt along with the crystal fragments.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: I never expected to get away with destroying the gem meant for the Golden Empress. Just tell me the punishment I'll receive.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: I see no need to prosecute you, Herr Heinz. For me, the incident with the gem is merely an interlude.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: For some time now, Graf Saxon has attempted to ingratiate himself with the Kaiserinnen, all while secretly funding the remnants of the Witch King. He's been linked to several insurrections in recent years.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: As Grimmacht's envoy, I'm here to bring that avaricious, subversive worm back to Zwillingstürme.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: As for destroying the gem Ewigegnade sought for the Empresses' Celebration... I doubt Grimmacht has much interest in such frivolous things.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I'm just curious... what are your plans, now that your revenge is complete?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: You've become a household name these days. I found an invitation in the mailbox at the door and took the liberty of bringing it in.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I've also examined the devices you planted in the Graf's spire. Your skills as a thief are no less impressive than your talents as a gemologist.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Perhaps you can start a gem appraising business or something. I'm sure you'll never be short on 'business' in Leithanien.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Heinz opens the invitation that Michael had left on the worktable.
He recognizes the seal. It bears the mark of another spire.
'Graf Myers is touring Leithanien with 'Träneperle des Himmel,' the crown jewel from his gem mines. Grinden will be his next stop.'
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: 'Your appraisal will be much appreciated.'
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: If memory serves, Graf Myers's mines were shut down last year after a series of infections revealed serious safety violations.
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Another 'Saxon,' eh?
attributes.name: Heinz

attributes.content: Maybe there's something to his suggestion, after all.
attributes.name: Heinz
